intro: Chiridium, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are typically low-growing shrubs with evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are usually leathery and glossy, while the flowers range in color from white to pink or purple. Chiridium species are often found in rocky or acidic soils and are valued for their ornamental appeal in gardens.
